availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edwin R. Jackson (Harrison County, KY, merchant)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Eliza Jackson. Married to Mary W. Bryson Jackson in Harrison County, Kentucky, on August 14, 1854. Merchant in Harrison County in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Merchant in Harrison County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 98B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 365.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 658.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 127A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film 000216888, p. 451.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Harrison County Administrators Bonds, 1863-1869, p. 361.
